title: Change in context menu alignment starting 140.0
content:
Prior to FF140 the context menu button labels left placeholders on the left that aligned the labels with extension buttons. Currently the labels moved to the left edge, which is a bit annoying after them being in the same place for years.

Was this a planned change or is this a bug I should report to bugzilla?

Curiously, if there is at lest one item with a checkbox (e.g. this textbox) all items return to their old alignment. I find that even more distracting.

title: Does Firefox automatically restart the GPU process when its memory usage is too high?
content: This is a technical question. Recently, Mozilla added the ability to manually restart the GPU process in about:processes, which is very useful when it leaks memory. Does anyone know if they also programmed Firefox to automatically restart the GPU process if its memory usage becomes suspiciously high, for example, if it exceeds a very high percentage of system RAM at a reasonable baseline (e.g. 7GB out of 8GB RAM)? That would help reduce complaints about GPU process memory leaks. Thanks.

title: How to restore an older browsing session
content: I have Firefox 140.0.2 . A few days ago I lost all the tabs of my session while using, for the first time, the CSV export of my Pocket saves. Using the Firefox menu in the upper right, I found that there were no previous tabs listed to be restored and all previous windows were empty save for the individual links from my Pocket saves. My search history was also empty although my settings are set to save it. There was nothing to salvage and I gave-up perplexed. Today I am researching. I am learning that earlier sessions can be restored via backups. I've found my "sessionstore-backups" folder and jsonlz4 and baklz4 files. It is here that I get overwhelmed following the written directions in Firefox Help (link text. I stalled at step 5. I looked for video help and couldn't find anything. I would appreciate any assistance with this for me, a non-savvy computer user. Oh, I use a mac if that is relevant. Thanks. Mary

title: Mouse cursor is huge since recent update (Linux)
content: I am using Firefox v140.0.1 Snap on Kubuntu 25.04, Kernel 6.14. Since the Firefox update in the past couple days, the mouse cursor has started appearing huge and slightly blurry (as though the image is scaled up) in Firefox and nowhere else. The size is visually annoying, and occasionally difficult to know exactly where I'm clicking (trying to move the caret in a text box for example). It also appears to be a different style from the main desktop cursor, the shape and color are ever so slightly different, but this may already have been the case and I simply didn't notice because of the previously small size. Firefox doesn't have its own built in cursor settings that I can find, nor obey the system cursor settings. I have a high DPI display so perhaps it is being over-compensated for? e.g. both the system and Firefox are scaling the cursor up, assuming the other hasn't done it already, resulting in a cursor that's too big.

title: In Picture-in-picture feature, spacebar activates last-used UI element, not play/pause
content:
When using the picture-in-picture feature, the spacebar is meant to be a keyboard shortcut to pause or continue the video. This is shown on the tooltips for the UI elements in the picture-in-picture feature, and on the keyboard shortcuts in https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/about-picture-picture-firefox#w_keyboard-shortcuts

However, what actually happens when I press the spacebar key is it instead activates the last UI element to have been clicked on in the picture-in-picture.

For example, if I have last clicked the fullscreen icon to make the picture-in-picture fullscreen, pressing the spacebar will toggle the fullscreen mode, and not pause or continue the video.

title: DNS DoH
content: Olá pessoal, estou com uma situação intrigante sobre o DNS DoH do Firefox vs Chrome. Meu roteador possui o Trend Micro AIProtection, então ele intercepta os domínios acessados. Porém se utilizo DNS DoH (Proteção máxima), por consequência no Chrome e derivdos o AIProtection não consegue interceptar e é possível acessar qualquer site que esteja em blacklist. Mas com firefox e qualquer fork, os domínios ainda são interceptados e bloqueados. Mesmo se eu desligar o DNS seguro em ambos os navegadores, e utilizar apenas o DNS DoH configurado no Windows 11, o comportamento é o mesmo. Qualquer navegador Chromium consegue se ocultar de interceptações. Estou a dias fazendo experimentos e análises, mas não consigo solucionar esse problema com o firefox. Antecipando... não há vazamento DNS e SNI é seguro. Será o motor firefox menos seguro que chromium neste sentido ?
creator: jardel

As international travel becomes more complex due to changing visa regulations, health protocols, and global mobility trends, the Turkish Airlines Houston office serves as a beacon of clarity. The team stays up to date with the latest requirements for entry and transit, advising travelers on necessary documentation, vaccination records, and travel insurance. This proactive guidance is particularly crucial for travelers connecting through Istanbul en route to countries with varying entry conditions. The Houston office also supports passengers in understanding transit times, visa waiver rules, and layover options such as Turkish Airlines’ free Stopover or Touristanbul programs, which allow eligible passengers to explore Istanbul during extended layovers. With a growing demand for personalized and dependable airline service, the Turkish Airlines Houston office remains a vital partner in shaping world-class travel experiences. Its staff are trained to deliver both efficiency and empathy, ensuring that every interaction—whether in-person, over the phone, or via email—reflects the airline’s global standards. Whether you’re a first-time flyer or a seasoned traveler, the office offers consistent value through accurate information, prompt service, and thoughtful problem-solving. In today’s fast-paced and ever-evolving travel landscape, having a trusted local resource like the Turkish Airlines Houston office makes all the difference in ensuring travel remains a source of excitement, not stress. In conclusion, the Turkish Airlines Houston office is more than just a regional extension of an international airline—it’s a travel ally for anyone embarking on a global journey. It embodies Turkish Airlines’ commitment to exceptional service, operational excellence, and cultural understanding. From helping customers find the best routes and fares to supporting them through every stage of their travel, the Houston office brings global reach to a local level. With Turkish Airlines connecting Houston to the world through Istanbul, the possibilities are endless—and it all starts with the dedicated team at the Turkish Airlines Houston office.

Whether it's arranging wheelchair services, oxygen equipment, special meal requests, or assistance for elderly passengers, the office ensures that all policies are explained thoroughly and that arrangements are made in compliance with the airline's service standards. Its responsiveness and ability to personalize group travel solutions make it a preferred partner for bulk travel planning. Additionally, the Flydubai Dubai office supports the airline’s digital ecosystem by helping less tech-savvy travelers navigate online platforms. While Flydubai’s mobile app and website are robust and user-friendly, many customers still prefer in-person support for mobile check-ins, digital boarding passes, flight status notifications, and managing their bookings. The Dubai office bridges this gap by offering tech-assisted walk-throughs and ensuring that passengers feel confident using Flydubai’s online tools for future travel. This blend of high-tech and high-touch support enhances passenger empowerment while maintaining the warmth of personalized customer care. From a branding standpoint, the Flydubai Dubai office also serves as a physical representation of the airline’s commitment to regional leadership, innovation, and excellence in service. With Dubai being a globally recognized center for trade, tourism, and innovation, the Flydubai office embodies these values by offering a modern, customer-centric experience in tune with the city’s energy and pace. title: turkish airlines london office
content: With the growing emphasis on travel sustainability and eco-conscious flying, the Turkish Airlines London office also supports initiatives aligned with the airline’s environmental goals. Turkish Airlines has been investing in fuel-efficient aircraft and green operations, and the London office contributes by educating passengers on carbon offset programs, digital boarding passes, and paperless ticketing. In this way, the office serves as a local ambassador for the airline’s global vision of sustainable aviation. It also plays a role in coordinating corporate social responsibility efforts, including student travel programs, charitable partnerships, and emergency travel assistance during global events. Another important aspect of the Turkish Airlines London office is its integration with the airline’s loyalty program, Miles&Smiles. Frequent flyers can receive support with account issues, mile redemption, status upgrades, and exclusive partner offers through the London office. This direct access to loyalty management empowers customers to maximize their benefits and enhance their overall flying experience. Members are guided through the process of earning and spending miles on flights, hotel bookings, car rentals, and lifestyle purchases—transforming travel into a rewarding journey every time. Travelers also turn to the Turkish Airlines London office for assistance during disruptions, such as strikes, weather delays, or travel restrictions. In uncertain times, having a reliable point of contact is invaluable, and the London office serves that role with professionalism and efficiency. From arranging alternative travel routes to processing refunds or vouchers, the staff ensure that customers remain informed and supported throughout the process. Their local presence means quicker response times and a better understanding of regional passenger expectations, making a significant difference during time-sensitive situations. Moreover, the Turkish Airlines London office supports group bookings, educational tours, and large-scale travel arrangements for organizations and institutions. Schools, businesses, and tour operators frequently engage with the office to coordinate logistics for international travel, ensuring compliance with airline policies and achieving cost-effective planning. Dedicated agents assist with documentation, group fare negotiations, and customized scheduling, streamlining the process for organizers. This specialized service makes the London office a preferred partner for bulk travel coordination in the UK.

title: Mozilla will provide security updates for Firefox 115 ESR until at least 115.27.0esr in August 2025
content:
Hi Mozilla Team / Community,

We understand that Firefox 115 ESR will receive security updates until at least version 115.27.0esr in August 2025.

We currently have a number of devices still running Windows 7 for legacy application reasons and rely on Firefox 115 ESR as it's the last version to support that OS.

We need to plan ahead, so could you please confirm:

Will Mozilla continue to support Windows 7 with Firefox 115 ESR updates until August 2025?

Or is support for Windows 7 ending sooner, even if 115 ESR itself continues?

title: FF 140.0 - How to disable new "Manage use of DRM Software" icon in browser bar?
content:
Ever since upgrading to FF 140 yesterday, there is a new icon labeled "Manage use of DRM Software" in the browser just left of the URL, which violently shakes every time I open a website that requires approval to play DRM content.

Now, I do not play any DRM content and have deactivated anything related in the settings, yet every time I open e.g. discord.com where users might embed music or videos in chat rooms (that are optional and ignored by me) that silly icon starts shaking again, which is super annoying.

Is there a way to remove it altogether, or AT LEAST disable the shaking?

title: After last windows update this week Microsoft Family safety settings STOP Firefox from starting
content:
After my last Windows 10 update this week, suddenly, Microsoft Family safety settings STOP Firefox from starting up! Can't start Firefox. DRASTIC! DEVASTATING So I HAD to import everything from Firefox to Edge browser, just to send this message. But I left Firefox as my default browser. I am the head my Family group in Family Safety settings.

After clicking on Firefox I get the following message from Family Safety: "You can't use Firefox because of your family safety settings, but it doesn't hurt to ask" Then there's a place to click on: ASK TO USE(Firefox) 

  Before clicking on this I removed internet access to my machine. ASK TO USE is a permission FROM Microsoft that never comes if clicked on. These people have HIJACKED my ability to use Firefox.

They should be sued.

title: Urgent Assistance Required – Phishing Incident Involving Removed Addon
content:
Good afternoon,

My name is Ivan Prokopiev, and I need urgent assistance.

On June 19, 2025, I installed a Coinbase-related addon from provider "wallet" (it was on the first lines of search results). Unfortunately, this turned out to be a phishing application, and it has since been removed. As a result, I’ve had over $80,000 stolen from my wallet (June 19, 2025. 17-20).

I am asking for your help in identifying or contacting the provider of this malicious addon. I would like to try recovering at least part of the stolen funds.

Regrettably, I do not have a screenshot or any direct proof of the addon I installed. If you have access to any logs or records that could confirm its presence or details, I would greatly appreciate it. Alternatively, could you guide me on how I might locate this information in my browser history or logs?

Thank you in advance for your support.

Sincerely, Ivan Prokopiev my email sham4ik2010@gmail.com

---

Let me know if you’re sending this to a specific company (e.g., the wallet provider), and I can tailor it more precisely.

title: Nové menu … programu Firefox
content: Hezký den Měl jsem svůj iPad v opravně na výměnu baterky. Vše jsem smazal. Po obnovení ze zálohy mě překvapilo že místo hamburger menu jsem měl menu s … A to i přesto, že iPad a ostatní svá zařízení aktualizuji. A teď k mému požadavku: používám iPad na šířku. V menu jsem více jak hodinu hledal “odeslat panel do jiných zařízení”. Víte co je špatně? Menu ma jinak položky a není vidět, že se dá scrolovat dolu. Chybí tam třeba šipečka. Prohledal jsem nápovědu, ptal jsem se různých ai. Myslím si, že nebudu sám. Položka byla dole níže než v základní pohledu a netušil jsem, že menu je scrolovatelné - předtím nebylo nebo všechny prvky, co jsem používal byly videť. Tomáš - produktový manažer telko

title: Recommended add-ons that should be removed
content:
It seems there is no process in place for checking if recommended add-ons are still worthy of being recommended.

Easy Youtube Video Downloader Express is a prime example. It hasn't worked for a long time, was last updated in April 2024, and the developer no long responds to any form of communication. And yet it still one of your recommended add-ons. How can this be? Not only should it not be recommended, it should be removed.
